name: forced
content:

done against your wishes: forced repatriation
An action that is forced is done because it is suddenly made necessary by a new and usually unexpected situation: forced landing The plane had to make a forced landing because one of the engines failed.
used to describe laughter, a smile, or an emotion that is produced with effort and is not sincerely felt: She tried hard to smile but suspected that it looked forced.
